result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J Feagles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000-$100,000 [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

11:03 am
Assistant District Attorney Kat Turner: Present 
Defendant present - in custody - via Zoom.
Defendant still wishes to represent himself.
Agreement placed on the record by ADA Turner.
The defendant was advised of his right to an in person hearing with Court.  Defendant wishes to proceed today. 
Defendant questioned by the Court and advised of rights.
Plea - guilty - counts 1 and 2.
Defendant admits prior conviction making this a repeater.
Court accepts his plea and finds guilty of counts 1 and 2.
Recommendations by ADA Turner.
Statements by the defendant.
Statements by the Court.
Court orders:
Count 1 - 3 years prison system with 18 months initial confinement followed by 18 months extended supervision.
Concurrent with any other sentences now serving.   Commence forthwith.
Pay costs - directly to the Clerk of Court - due in 60 days.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Restitution as indicated on order - to be paid to Agent.
Count 2 - 30 days jail commencing forthwith concurrent with count 1 and any other sentence now serving.
Costs - due in 60 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. 
Advised of appeal rights
Advised of firearm and voting restrictions.

Bond Terminated Slip
